{"body":"<p><br/> I really need some help. I'm trying to make my own Timeline chart (the same as google timeline). It works already but I can not figure out how to make a function for grouping labels by type. I hardcoded this function and it works for 3 groups/types. What I need is to make a universal function that groups all labels even if there are 100 of them. <br/> The second problem is that in the second and third groups are not in the same line if a.endTime &gt;= b.startTime. I will be very thankful for every help <br/>\nHere is my code:</p>\n<p><div class=\"snippet\" data-lang=\"js\" data-hide=\"false\" data-console=\"true\" data-babel=\"false\">\r\n<div class=\"snippet-code\">\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-js lang-js prettyprint-override\"><code>var w = 800;\nvar h = 400;\n\nvar svg = d3\n  .select(\".svg\")\n  .append(\"svg\")\n  .attr(\"width\", w)\n  .attr(\"height\", h)\n  .attr(\"class\", \"svg\");\n\n//main array\nvar items = [{\n    task: \"conceptualize\",\n    type: \"development\",\n    startTime: \"2013-1-28\", //year/month/day\n    endTime: \"2013-2-1\",\n    number: 2,\n  },\n\n  {\n    task: \"sketch\",\n    type: \"development\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-6\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-9\",\n    number: 2,\n  },\n\n  {\n    task: \"color profiles\",\n    type: \"development\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-6\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-9\",\n    number: 2,\n  },\n\n  {\n    task: \"HTML\",\n    type: \"coding\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-2\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-6\",\n    number: 1,\n  },\n\n  {\n    task: \"write the JS\",\n    type: \"coding\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-1\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-6\",\n    number: 1,\n  },\n  {\n    task: \"eat\",\n    type: \"celebration\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-8\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-13\",\n    number: 0,\n  },\n\n  {\n    task: \"crying\",\n    type: \"celebration\",\n    startTime: \"2013-2-13\",\n    endTime: \"2013-2-16\",\n    number: 0,\n  },\n];\n\n//array sorting\nitems.sort((a, b) =&gt; {\n  return (\n    a.number - b.number || Date.parse(b.startTime) - Date.parse(a.startTime)\n  );\n});\n\n//here create new array and add index for every label\nvar taskArray = [];\nvar stack = [];\nitems.map((e) =&gt; {\n  var lane = stack.findIndex(\n    (s) =&gt; s.endTime &lt;= e.startTime &amp;&amp; s.startTime &lt; e.startTime\n  );\n\n  var yIndex = lane === -1 ? stack.length : lane;\n  taskArray.push({\n    ...e,\n    yIndex,\n  });\n  stack[yIndex] = e;\n});\n\n//here hardcoded grouping based on index and type\nvar nRows = d3.max(taskArray, (d) =&gt;\n  d.type === \"celebration\" ? d.yIndex + 1 : null\n);\n\n//here hardcoded grouping based on index and type\nvar nRows2 = d3.max(taskArray, (d) =&gt;\n  d.type === \"development\" ? (d.yIndex = d.yIndex + 1 + nRows) : null\n);\n\nvar dateFormat = d3.time.format(\"%Y-%m-%d\");\n\nvar timeScale = d3.time\n  .scale()\n  .domain([\n    d3.min(taskArray, function(d) {\n      return dateFormat.parse(d.startTime);\n    }),\n    d3.max(taskArray, function(d) {\n      return dateFormat.parse(d.endTime);\n    }),\n  ])\n  .range([0, w - 150]);\n\nvar categories = new Array();\n\nfor (var i = 0; i &lt; taskArray.length; i++) {\n  categories.push(taskArray[i].type);\n}\n\nvar catsUnfiltered = categories; //for vert labels\n\ncategories = checkUnique(categories);\n\nmakeGant(taskArray, w, h);\n\nfunction makeGant(tasks, pageWidth, pageHeight) {\n  var barHeight = 20;\n  var gap = barHeight + 4;\n  var topPadding = 75;\n  var sidePadding = 75;\n\n  var colorScale = d3.scale\n    .linear()\n    .domain([0, categories.length])\n    .range([\"#00B9FA\", \"#F95002\"])\n    .interpolate(d3.interpolateHcl);\n\n  makeGrid(sidePadding, topPadding, pageWidth, pageHeight);\n  drawRects(\n    tasks,\n    gap,\n    topPadding,\n    sidePadding,\n    barHeight,\n    colorScale,\n    pageWidth,\n    pageHeight\n  );\n  vertLabels(gap, topPadding, sidePadding, barHeight, colorScale);\n}\n\nfunction drawRects(\n  theArray,\n  theGap,\n  theTopPad,\n  theSidePad,\n  theBarHeight,\n  theColorScale,\n  w,\n  h\n) {\n  svg\n    .append(\"g\")\n    .selectAll(\"rect\")\n    .data(theArray)\n    .enter()\n    .append(\"rect\")\n    .attr(\"x\", 0)\n    .attr(\"y\", function(d, i) {\n      return d.yIndex * theGap + theTopPad - 2;\n    })\n    .attr(\"width\", function(d) {\n      return w - theSidePad / 2;\n    })\n    .attr(\"height\", theGap)\n    .attr(\"stroke\", \"none\")\n    .attr(\"fill\", function(d) {\n      for (var i = 0; i &lt; categories.length; i++) {\n        if (d.type == categories[i]) {\n          return d3.rgb(theColorScale(i));\n        }\n      }\n    })\n    .attr(\"opacity\", 0.2);\n\n  var rectangles = svg.append(\"g\").selectAll(\"rect\").data(theArray).enter();\n\n  rectangles\n    .append(\"rect\")\n    .attr(\"rx\", 3)\n    .attr(\"ry\", 3)\n    .attr(\"x\", function(d) {\n      return timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.startTime)) + theSidePad;\n    })\n    //here draw milestones depend on index\n    .attr(\"y\", function(d, i) {\n      return d.yIndex * theGap + theTopPad;\n    })\n    .attr(\"width\", function(d) {\n      return (\n        timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.endTime)) -\n        timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.startTime))\n      );\n    })\n    .attr(\"height\", theBarHeight)\n    .attr(\"stroke\", \"none\")\n    .attr(\"fill\", function(d) {\n      for (var i = 0; i &lt; categories.length; i++) {\n        if (d.type == categories[i]) {\n          return d3.rgb(theColorScale(i));\n        }\n      }\n    });\n\n  rectangles\n    .append(\"text\")\n    .text(function(d) {\n      return d.task;\n    })\n    .attr(\"x\", function(d) {\n      return (\n        (timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.endTime)) -\n          timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.startTime))) /\n        2 +\n        timeScale(dateFormat.parse(d.startTime)) +\n        theSidePad\n      );\n    })\n    .attr(\"y\", function(d, i) {\n      return d.yIndex * theGap + 14 + theTopPad;\n    })\n    .attr(\"font-size\", 11)\n    .attr(\"text-anchor\", \"middle\")\n    .attr(\"text-height\", theBarHeight)\n    .attr(\"fill\", \"#fff\");\n}\n\nfunction makeGrid(theSidePad, theTopPad, w, h) {\n  var xAxis = d3.svg\n    .axis()\n    .scale(timeScale)\n    .orient(\"bottom\")\n    .ticks(d3.time.days, 1)\n    .tickSize(-h + theTopPad + 20, 0, 0)\n    .tickFormat(d3.time.format(\"%d %b\"));\n\n  var grid = svg\n    .append(\"g\")\n    .attr(\"class\", \"grid\")\n    .attr(\"transform\", \"translate(\" + theSidePad + \", \" + (h - 50) + \")\")\n    .call(xAxis)\n    .selectAll(\"text\")\n    .style(\"text-anchor\", \"middle\")\n    .attr(\"fill\", \"#000\")\n    .attr(\"stroke\", \"none\")\n    .attr(\"font-size\", 10)\n    .attr(\"dy\", \"1em\");\n}\n\nfunction vertLabels(\n  theGap,\n  theTopPad,\n  theSidePad,\n  theBarHeight,\n  theColorScale\n) {\n  var numOccurances = new Array();\n  var prevGap = 0;\n\n  for (var i = 0; i &lt; categories.length; i++) {\n    numOccurances[i] = [categories[i], getCount(categories[i], catsUnfiltered)];\n  }\n\n  var axisText = svg\n    .append(\"g\") //without doing this, impossible to put grid lines behind text\n    .selectAll(\"text\")\n    .data(numOccurances)\n    .enter()\n    .append(\"text\")\n    .text(function(d) {\n      return d[0];\n    })\n    .attr(\"x\", 10)\n    .attr(\"y\", function(d, i) {\n      if (i &gt; 0) {\n        for (var j = 0; j &lt; i; j++) {\n          prevGap += numOccurances[i - 1][1];\n          // console.log(prevGap);\n          return (d[1] * theGap) / 2 + prevGap * theGap + theTopPad;\n        }\n      } else {\n        return (d[1] * theGap) / 2 + theTopPad;\n      }\n    })\n    .attr(\"font-size\", 11)\n    .attr(\"text-anchor\", \"start\")\n    .attr(\"text-height\", 14)\n    .attr(\"fill\", function(d) {\n      for (var i = 0; i &lt; categories.length; i++) {\n        if (d[0] == categories[i]) {\n          //  console.log(\"true!\");\n          return d3.rgb(theColorScale(i)).darker();\n        }\n      }\n    });\n}\n\n//from this stackexchange question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1890203/unique-for-arrays-in-javascript\nfunction checkUnique(arr) {\n  var hash = {},\n    result = [];\n  for (var i = 0, l = arr.length; i &lt; l; ++i) {\n    if (!hash.hasOwnProperty(arr[i])) {\n      //it works with objects! in FF, at least\n      hash[arr[i]] = true;\n      result.push(arr[i]);\n    }\n  }\n  return result;\n}\n\n//from this stackexchange question: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14227981/count-how-many-strings-in-an-array-have-duplicates-in-the-same-array\nfunction getCounts(arr) {\n  var i = arr.length, // var to loop over\n    obj = {}; // obj to store results\n  while (i) obj[arr[--i]] = (obj[arr[i]] || 0) + 1; // count occurrences\n  return obj;\n}\n\n// get specific from everything\nfunction getCount(word, arr) {\n  return getCounts(arr)[word] || 0;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-css lang-css prettyprint-override\"><code>body {\n  background: #fff;\n  font-family: 'Open-Sans', sans-serif;\n}\n\n#container {\n  margin: 0 auto;\n  position: relative;\n  width: 800px;\n  overflow: visible;\n}\n\n.svg {\n  width: 800px;\n  height: 400px;\n  overflow: visible;\n  position: absolute;\n}\n\n.grid .tick {\n  stroke: lightgrey;\n  opacity: 0.3;\n  shape-rendering: crispEdges;\n}\n\n.grid path {\n  stroke-width: 0;\n}</code></pre>\r\n<pre class=\"snippet-code-html lang-html prettyprint-override\"><code>&lt;div id=\"container\"&gt;\n  &lt;div class=\"svg\"&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;/div&gt;\n&lt;script src=\"https://d3js.org/d3.v3.min.js\"&gt;&lt;/script&gt;</code></pre>\r\n</div>\r\n</div>\r\n</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":376,"question_id":65002755,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>The SQL password expires every 24 hour once (The interval might change anytime without prior notice), hence I want to validate the authentication using Sequelize beforeConnect hook before I run a SQL query.</p>\n<p>Without async await the SQL query will fail and then authenticate and the preceding queries will pass. I want to run the code async way so no SQL queries fail. Kindly help me fix this problem.</p>\n<pre><code>    const sequelize = new Sequelize(database, username, password, params);\n\n    sequelize.beforeConnect(async (currConfig) =&gt; {\n        try {\n            await sequelize.authenticate();\n            console.log('Connection has been established successfully.');\n        } catch (error) {\n            console.error('Unable to connect to the database:', error);\n        }\n    });\n\n</code></pre>\n","userId":1,"threadId":377,"question_id":65002748,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<pre><code>\nshowInNavigator: true,\n     navigatorOptions: {\n        visible:true,\n},\n</code></pre>\n<p><strong>I Added these lines in the series it is showing the series in the navigator when it's loaded but after selecting and deselecting it's not showing this series in the navigator. I want to show this series in the navigation no matter it's visible or not. It's working first time only but after enabling and disabling that series it get hidden</strong></p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":379,"question_id":65002716,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
{"body":"<p>I would like to put a hook in state for the initialization of my variable :</p>\n<pre><code>state = { \n    geo: new usePosition()\n}\n</code></pre>\n<p>But I got the following error :</p>\n<pre><code>Error: Invalid hook call. Hooks can only be called inside of the body of a function component. This could happen for one of the following reasons:\n1. You might have mismatching versions of React and the renderer (such as React DOM)\n2. You might be breaking the Rules of Hooks\n3. You might have more than one copy of React in the same app\n</code></pre>\n<p>I really need to put this hook in my state for the initialization of my variable...</p>\n<p>Could you help me please ?</p>\n<p>Thank you very much !</p>\n","userId":1,"threadId":378,"question_id":65002720,"isQuestion":true,"score":0},
